content: stuffy owl knitting pattern by amanda berry ❤ email fluffandfuzz@googlemail com website fluffandfuzz@weebly com yarn - this little owl is knitted in wool/alpaca blend aran weight yarns medium/worsted and uses less than 25g in each of three yarn shades grey to knit the owl plus white and yellow to embroider the details - the owl photographed was knitted in drops nepal 65% wool/35% alpaca in shades grey mix 0501 white 1101 and goldenrod 2923 needles & notions - a pair of 4 5mm us 7 single pointed knitting needles minimum length 20cm - a darning or tapestry needle for seaming - a large handful of toy filling - two 6mm toy safety eyes or you can use buttons or beads copyright © 2016 amanda berry this free pattern is for personal use only not for resale all patterns designed by introduction this a simple to knit owl and there is no tricky colour-work as the features are owl body embroidered after knitting using swiss darning make 1 cast on 15 sts in grey on 4 5mm needles duplicate stitch start at the bottom edge work flat knit flat back and forth on a pair of row 1 ws purl single pointed knitting needles not in the round row 2 rs k1 kfb knit to the last 2 sts kfb k1 casting on use the long tail cast on for this 17 sts pattern row 3 to 8 repeat row 1 and 2 three more times pull through to cast off cut the yarn leaving at 23 sts least a 30cm tail thread the tail onto a darning row 9 to 19 starting on a ws purl row work 11 needle and sew through the remaining sts on the row in st st knitting needle pull the sts off the knitting needle onto the yarn gather together tightly and secure row 20 k1 ssk knit to the last 3 sts k2tog k1 21 sts stockinette stitch also known as stocking stitch purl the ws row and knit the rs row row 21 to 23 starting on a ws purl row work 3 row in st st one size 10cm tall x 9cm wide row 24 repeat row 20 19 sts gauge 17 sts x 22 row for a 10cm x 10cm square in stockinette stitch on 4 5mm needles don t worry row 25 to 27 starting on a ws purl row work 3 about gauge for this pattern it is not critical row in st st row 28 repeat row 20 17 sts abbreviations row 29 purl row 30 k1 kfb knit to the last 2 sts kfb k1
